intro: Cotyledon font-queri, commonly known as the African snowball, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a powdery white coating, known as farina. The plant produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a desirable addition to many landscapes.
